metadata.title: CVE-2016-5325 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
CRLF injection vulnerability in the ServerResponse#writeHead function inNode.js 0.10.x before 0.10.47, 0.12.x before 0.12.16, 4.x before 4.6.0, and6.x before 6.7.0 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headersand conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via the reason argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5325` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 4.2.6~dfsg-1ubuntu4.2
nodejs-legacy - 4.2.6~dfsg-1ubuntu4.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.6~dfsg-1ubuntu4.2').
